conclusion: The working principle of the electromagnetic railgun involves a projectile moving between two parallel rails with current generating a magnetic field.
Xiao Ming purchased a railgun model with specific parameters: rail length, rail spacing, projectile mass, rail current, and magnetic field strength.
The problem asks for the power of the electromagnetic railgun when the projectile is launched.
The image shows a projectile moving between two parallel rails with current flowing and generating a magnetic field.
Identify key parameters: rail length, rail spacing, projectile mass, rail current, and magnetic field strength.
The Lorentz force acting on the projectile is given by F = I * B * d.
Substitute values into Lorentz force equation: F = 10 * 1 * 0.02 = 0.2 N.
Use equation of motion: F = (m * v^2) / L.
Substitute values into equation of motion: 0.2 = (0.02 * v^2) / 0.5.
The power of the railgun is given by P = F * v.
The power of the electromagnetic railgun when the projectile is launched is 0.2 sqrt(5) W.
